Order.title: Order
Order.description: Represents a customer's JasTip (jasa titip) order.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Order entity.

userId.description: The ID of the user who placed the order.

eventId.description: The ID of the event this order belongs to.

customerName.description: The name of the customer who this order is for.

itemDescription.description: Description of the item being ordered.

quantity.description: Quantity of the item being ordered.

specificRequests.description: Any special requests or instructions for the order.

createdAt.description: The date and time the order was placed.

status.description: The current status of the order (e.g., Paid, Not Paid).

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure uses a simple, flat structure for key collections like 'events' and 'orders'. User profiles are kept separate in a 'users' collection. This design is straightforward and relies on Firestore queries with 'where' clauses to fetch related data (e.g., getting all orders for a specific event). Security rules will be crucial to ensure users can only access the data they are permitted to see.
